story:
Once upon a time, in a small village in the Philippines, there was a young boy named JV who lived with his mother. JV was a kind and curious boy, always eager to learn new things and help those around him.

One day, JV's mother told him a story about a magical creature that lived in the forest near their village. The creature was called the "Aswang," and it was said to have the power to transform into different animals and creatures.

JV was fascinated by the story and begged his mother to take him to the forest to see the Aswang for himself. His mother warned him that the Aswang was a dangerous creature and that he should stay away, but JV was determined.

The next day, JV set out early in the morning to the forest. He wandered deeper and deeper into the woods, calling out for the Aswang to show itself. Suddenly, he heard a rustling in the bushes and turned to see a large, shadowy figure looming over him.

JV's heart raced as the figure came closer, and he saw that it was indeed the Aswang. But to his surprise, the creature did not attack him. Instead, it spoke to him in a gentle voice and said, "I have been watching you, JV. You are a kind and curious boy, just like I once was. But be careful, JV, for not all creatures in the forest have good intentions."

JV was surprised by the Aswang's words, but he listened carefully. The Aswang went on to tell JV about the different creatures that lived in the forest and how to stay safe around them. JV listened intently and thanked the Aswang for its advice.

From that day on, JV became known as the "Aswang Whisperer" and would often go into the forest to learn more from the magical creature. He would share the knowledge he gained with his village, helping to keep them safe from the dangers of the forest.

And so, JV and his mother lived happily, with JV always remembering the lessons he learned from the Aswang and using them to help those around him.

Goodnight my dear, remember to always be kind, curious and brave.

The end.
